summary: The 'No Tax Subsidies for Stadiums Act of 2025' aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to prevent the use of tax-exempt bonds for financing professional sports stadiums. The bill defines a 'professional stadium bond' and specifies that any bond used to fund facilities used for professional sports exhibitions, games, or training is not eligible for tax-exempt status. The effective date of the amendments is for bonds issued after the enactment of the Act.
